Reviews.Title: “March Visit”
Reviews.Author: Giusa H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from visiting this hotel last week. The hotel was clean and we had a basic room which had more than enough room, lovely views and a great bathroom for European standards. It is very close to Jacques Bonsergant stop on the Metro (seconds to walk), however the hotel itself is not close to anything if you are hoping to see the major sites. If you are not afraid to go out on the subways, most places are only one transfer away. The hotel staff was helpful and the breakfast was lovely. We had a front facing room and it was noisy, which wasn't a huge deal but if you're a light sleeper you may want to ask for a room facing the back. All in all, a good hotel but for myself, I'd want to stay closer to downtown next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice if you are using Eurostar and good location to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: spanner1967
Reviews.Content: We got a deal through Voyage Privé which made our 3 night stay very good value. Paid extra to upgrade to a deluxe room which was still small and limited. Bathroom was very small and a bit tired. Breakfast was fine and plenty of it. Great base from which to explore - metro very close, station 10 minute walk or couple of stops on metro. Think we would have been disappointed if we had paid full price due to size of room, but the positive outweighs the negative so if it's a base from which to explore you are after this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: nomad401
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a total of 2 nights while travelling through Paris. The hotel itself seems to be very expensive at normal rates however we booked a last minute deal at a great price. The hotel itself is about a 15minute walk from the Eurostar (international) train station which is very handy if like us you travel in/out of France on train. There are many hotels closer to the station but any closer the area gets very bad, however the proximity of this hotel (not too close, but not too far) was great. The staff here are bilingual and will happily assist with requests in English which is helpful if you are French-challenged like we were! The room itself was cozy but very clean with a comfortable bed and clean/new looking bathroom. The hotel also has free wifi in the rooms which was very helpful. The hotel is close to Republic Square which has food and some shopping and very close to the metro stations that will take you into the centre of Paris. A good find in an unfamiliar city.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PickyPegger
Reviews.Content: We arrived severely jet lagged at 8am (check in isn't until the afternoon) and they stored our baggage for us. The staff's English was a good as out Francais so communication was slow but they staff took their time and answered all of our questions. The location was fantastic, we could walk to all of the places we wanted to check out and their were plenty of places to eat later at night close by. The room was had looked into a quiet courtyard and our room was quite quiet. The rooms are quite small but clean and have everything we needed. The petit déjeuner was really great and was fresh and had both hot and cold options. Overall this hotel was a good value and was clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend it for the location, breakfast and cleanliness of the the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Was very pleasantly surprised by this modern 3 star hotel located just a 15 minute walk from Gare du Nord Eurostar Station. Impeccably high standards of cleanliness apply, wi fi is available throughout the hotel and the rooms are well equipped with king size beds and satellite television with sports channels. The reception team were exceptionally helpful with all our requests and proactive in making suggestions for trips and tours.The restaurant serves an excellent buffet breakfast at a good value nine euros . The fresh croissants are mouth watering.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms don't justify the so-so locations”
Reviews.Author: mikkol
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the New Year's eve time. Hotel Magenta by itself is quite alright. Whole hotel was filled WIFI hotspots. Service was professional in English. At night the door was locked unless you ring the bell to make sure you were a tourist-like figure. I would say the purple / magenta color theme hid its aged building rather well, though personally I would prefer brighter, whiter hotels so the carpets won't look the same no matter it's washed or not. My room had a double bed with adequate size (not big in any sense but okay). It had a large window facing interior squares facing other apartments which were quite comfortable and quiet. The noises were mainly from the other travelers who returned late or left early, but it was still manageable. The problem I see are similar to what Paul_Glynis below mentioned: the location. While it was conveniently located *near* 2 RER train stations. You can see clearly that areas near train stations aren't the best place to stay for more than 1 nights in Paris. The fact for this hotel is, we would still need to take 1 subway change to arrive our hotel (or you may walk for 10-15min if you are luggage free). What that means to a traveler with luggage is that, there's not much point to stay near the train station but not close to it because we still had to carry the heavy luggage to travel through those stupid stairs in subway tunnels and exits. On our way leaving Paris we simply took buses transferring to Opera to take the airport bus because we were just so tired to take the luggage with us via subways - which weren't too safe esp in RER train stations. If you have the 120+ euros to stay here and prefer some conveniences to / from airports, this is NOT your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Cedar_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work trip for one night and was pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. Smart, clean and modern and a 2-3 minute walk from the nearest metro stop which was in turn only 2 stops from Gare Du Nord. My room was big and clean and also quiet being at the back of the hotel but the shower wasn't great (this might have only been my room).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Glynis
Reviews.Content: About 2 minutes walk from Gare du Est and the same distance to Place de la Republique we found the hotel to be a perfect 2-night stop. Staff are attentive and for those of us who find French a challenge they do not mind English. We always find it strange in France that a country which has a huge influx of English speaking tourists their hotels almost entirely restrict English language tv to the BBC world news. Okay, who wants tv in Paris? Having spent a couple of days seeing 'everything' one night would have been pleasant. Nevertheless, a good choice and if you are fit and active 'everything' is within walking distance. Even the Eiffel Tower was only an hour stroll away. Breakfast was basic but wholesome and good value, for Paris, at 9 Euro. We didn't find the rooms as small as some people appear to be suggesting - perhaps they are bigger on the 6th floor? One romantic observation was the realisation we could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our room. Boulevard Magenta is a very busy road day and night so if you are sensitive to traffic noise look elsewhere or ask for a room on the top floors. Could have been exhaustion, trying to cram so much in to 2-nights, but we were not really troubled by it.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: this is a tourist hotel, and it makes no apologies for it. the rooms are small, but clean. breakfast is worth taking and is excellent. it has an elevator, which is a rareity in paris. the nearest metro station is only 50 metres, on the same side of the street as the hotel. If you are just passing through paris and want something that is good value for money -- and relatively inexpensive -- go for this place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: dentista87
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night.I liked this hotel. I especially liked the fact that I got a free upgrade to the deluxe room. Room was lovely and big and very warm. Could have been a bit more modern though considering (red carpet, older style phone and bathroom were a bit disappointing). Had breakfats included which I had brought up to my room free of charge. Consisted of pastries, bread, juice. Tea and coffee were provided free in the room. I tend to like really modern hotels which is why I'm probably a bit critical. The bathroom was by no means old, but not recently installed either., and there was a soap dispenser in the shower instead of the standard mini toiletries that are usually provided. Staff were friendly and helpful. However, the area would prevent me from going back, even if it was for one night. The area felt really quite run down compared to other places I had seen in Paris. Whilst the metro is about 2minutes walk away, it didn't feel like the safest of places, especially as a tourist. Then about 5-10mins up the road is Gare d'lest and Gare du Nord. I asked one of the locals if these areas were safe and he said 'no, not really'. I stayed here on New Years eve, and got the metro to meet some friends. On my way out of Gare du Nord station (at around 11pm) I was accosted by a group of about 10 drunk immigrant men. I'm lucky I wasn't assaulted or hurt in anyway, but that did make me feel very unsafe. On the way back from the NYE merriments, my friend and her boyfriend walked me back to my hotel from Gare d'lest, and it was more of the same seedy leery behaviour by really unsavoury characters. I really wouldn't recommend this area to anyone, especially not females. Pros: cash machine right next door, supermarket about 5mins up the road, loads of convenience stores. not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Even though I hate purple.”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to take our first trip together to Paris and picked this hotel because of its reasonable price, location and pretty vibe. We were not deceived. The people were very friendly and helpful. And even though the shower was small it was sort of romantic.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yujiang
Reviews.Content: We chose it because it is very close to the train station. The neighborhood is not bad. Some restaurants can be chosen. The room is a little small for two persons. Breakfast is normal for a 3-start European hotel. In conclusion, the location is a best reason to choose it.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: almayg
Reviews.Content: Good location, and ok for the price, did what it was supposed to do, On the metro line, hot water at all times, which sometimes doesn'thappen in paris. Had a nice lunch in a little resto across the road. Breakfast was free so that was a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Cheap with Easy Access Via Republica Metro Hub”
Reviews.Author: GMP_2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed September 24-October 2 in a triple facing the courtyard (no view but quite). Nothing fancy, but served our travel needs. Near Republica Metro stop on the Number 11 line, easy access to city (everything was less than 30 minutes by metro, we took it everywhere). Republica is a high volume hub, with lots of people at all times, we felt very safe walking down Magenta to Republica. We used the Chateau D'Eau stop on the #4 line once, I would suggest this is not a good direction to walk in. We also took a cab from Gare Du Nord to Magenta, sketchy neighborhood in that direction. We never ate at hotel, two nice bakeries along Magenta on the way to Republica, and a Macdonalds (their coffee is very good) at Republica. FranPrix market is also on way to Republica. Learn the metro system for easy access between sites that saves walking.

Reviews.Title: “"Good value"”
Reviews.Author: agsLisboa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Magenta Hotel from 1-5 October. I booked a single room but got a nice spacious triple. The hotel is modest but clean, well located with a nearby Metro Station. Breakfast is adequate. Actually that's what comes to mind about this hotel: you get what you pay for. I wanted a low price, decent hotel just for sleeping and that's what I got. No surprises good or bad. Highly recommended if you just want a decent place to sleep and spend the day walking the streets of Paris. Very practical and simple but not "charming" or "romantic", which are things some people may look for when going to Paris. Bottom line: if you are on a tight budget and you are not on a romantic journey it is a safe adequate choice. If you want romance don't be cheap and try something like "Le Pavillon de la Reine" :)))

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, and Good Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: vinzdee
Reviews.Content: Right next to a metro station, this hotel is clean, comfortable, and modern, with rooms well sized for Paris. We got breakfast for 2 for an additional 8 euros, and it was worth it. It consisted of warm croissants, great yogurt, cheese, eggs, charcuterie plate, and decent coffee. I would have given it 5 stars except our bathroom handle was loose and the housekeeper decided to remove it, take it with her/him and shut the door, so after a long day of Paris (no potties) sightseeing, it was an unfortunate surprise to be locked out of our bathroom. When my husband called the front desk, she offered no help and told him to try to find a way to open the door as I squirmed and resorted to taking the elevator to the basement to use the public bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and hip style hotel”
Reviews.Author: ravenspirit
Reviews.Content: This relatively newer hotel is smartly designed, has a 'hip' atmosphere and very nice rooms. The well approprated lobby has big comfy couches, an outdoor deck and plenty of MAC computers for those need to do internet work. Rooms are well designed and very modern. In a city as old as Paris, it refreshing to stay at a recently renovated hotel. Location is best for those needing to be near Gare L'est or Nord. Otherwise, about 15 minutes by metro to the main attractions along the Seine River. Hotel runs specials on Expedia.com and booking.com. I paid a discounted rate of 105 Euros solo.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: s_ramsam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights here in the first leg of our Europe tour. The choice was based on location, facilities, value for money and tripadvisor reviews. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and on checking in, we went up to find a large (for Paris) room which was all neatly made up and ready for us. Good start. The clean bathroom was spacious and had all the required facilities. Breakfast was very good. The location, very close to Metro line 5 station (Jacques Bonsergent) and also close to the big stations, Gare de l'Est and Gare du Nord (which is directly connected to CDG airport) was extremely convenient to move around Paris. The immediate surroundings with plenty of eating joints and shops had a very lively atmosphere. We are very happy with the choice we made and we were off to a good start in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Staff, Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dingo009
Reviews.Content: We traveled from Marseille to Paris by train and reached at 11.30 in night. I had a bad experience of not getting the room booked for me, in previous journey to Paris. This time around it completely changed. The front desk people were very friendly and co-operative. Check-In Check-Out without any hassle. If asked for any locations, they even provided us with printouts of the map. The booking was not with Breakfast included hence cannot comment about food. We had triple room booked. I would say it was that we got wrong room. It was at the top and without any balcony or window on walls. The windows were on the slanting roof. But the view was really amazing. Eiffel, Sacre Core were visible from bathroom. Apart from that it was spacious enough, clean, neat and tidy. Location of hotel is perfect. Easily reachable by Metro/Bus. A couple of Bus Stops from Gare Du Nord and Gare De L'Est. All in all very nice Hotel. I would recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok but.....”
Reviews.Author: sampayne30
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a present for my mums birthday and decided to pay a bit more for what I hoped would be a great hotel. On the whole the hotel was ok, certainly not as good as I had hoped, nothing special. The location was the best thing going for it, only a few mins walk to Gare de L'est. The rooms were fine but didn't look as good as they appear on the internet, extremely small. Had a TV but the signal was dreadful so couldn't watch it. The bathroom was good with power shower and clean white towels. The bed was actually very comfortable. Free safe in rooms (if you dare use, see below), free tea/coffee making facilities. Breakfast again was ok but they have gone for a modern look rather than comfort. The chairs might be ultra modern but so uncomfortable. Good choice of foods available. Unfortunately what happened on our last night ruined our trip and the hotel management is appalling. My mum used the safe in her room (we had 2 rooms) and on the last night which was meant to be a special night as it was her birthday, mum put her code in to open the safe and it kept saying error. Went to reception and were told she couldn't leave reception to help until next shift came in 30mins later. Weren't happy but had no choice to wait as all money and cards in safe. Eventually next receptionist came up, leaving desk unmanned, and couldn't do anything to fix it. The previous receptionist just didn't want to help; they work alone 12 hour shifts so they obviously had to leave reception to get drinks or go to toilet etc. He then said he didn't know what to do and when he got chance he would have a think. It was 8.15pm by then and I said it was meant to be a special night but he was not interested. I literally had to wait in reception for ages until he would do anything. I asked him to ring hotel manager and he said he's not in Paris. When I asked what he would do in an emergency, he suddenly couldn't spesk English very well. After hours of waiting around he said he would try the battery, which it was, and it took until 10pm to resolve the problem which ruined our night out. I know batteries do fail etc that's fine but it was the way it was managed, with the no care attitude that I have a problem with, and there was no apology for ruining my mum's birthday. If they had any conscience, they would of offered to lend us money to go out or offer to refund us our last night, as they ruined it. If this is how they manage problems, I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel. I was also really surprised that the hotel did nothing at all for my mum's birthday. They knew about it prior to our arrival; I put banners up in her room, so they couldn't say they didn't know. I have been away for loads of birthday's and every hotel has always done something, however small, even a bottle of wine but nothing at all from Magenta Paris. Overall Paris was great. but extremely expensive, 5 euros for a soft drink and 7 euros for small beer. The brasserie opposite hotel was great. Brilliant food at great price, well worth a visit. Did the tour bus over 2 days (the red one), well worth the money and metro was excellent to get around. Had a nice time but such a shame my mum's birthday was ruined by a poorly run hotel with unfriendly staff. Probably wouldn't return to Paris in a hurry as seen everything and too expensive. If I did I would not choose Magenta Paris as lots of other cheaper hotels looked just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the poor feedback this place has had.”
Reviews.Author: Davep0254
Reviews.Content: We came back from the Hotel Magenta yesterday and we thought the hotel was really nice. People have previously mentioned the place being dirty, the food being bad and the noise all night preventing a decent nights sleep. The negative reviews could quite easily put people off, we were very wary after reading them. We stayed for 5 days, the hotel is very clean, all the staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfasts are nice too. As for the noise in the street, we live in a fairly quiet area and we slept well every night and had the window open too as Paris was quite hot last week. If you arrive by plane from CDG then you will travel by train to the Gare Du Nord station, you can then change trains or walk from there, to be honest we walked but had we known before hand we would have changed trains and gone to the Jacques Bonsergent metro as it's miles easier and is literally 1 minute away from the hotel compared with 10 minutes from Gare Du Nord or 5 minutes from Gare De L'est, and when you have cases to drag about that makes a big difference. If you like Chinese food there is also a great place 'Ching Chongs' near the Gare De L'est that do a buffet for 12 Euros on a night or 9 Euros during the day. The only down side for us was the area that the hotel is located in, there are 2 streets very close by, Rue La Fayette & Boulevard De Strasbourg that didn't make us feel safe, especially later in the day, there is also a brasserie directly opposite the hotel that ripped us off with the price of some drinks. Although classed as a city centre hotel it is a little way out and if you don't walk as much as we do then you will definately have to take the metro. On the positive side we'd definately stay at the hotel again, on the negative side it probably won't happen as the nice sights of Paris are completely overshadowed by the scruffy parts and the feeling of not being safe. An american at the hotel was distracted and then pick pocketed, he lost $1000. I'd recommend a visit to the Moulin Rouge while in Paris, we went on a trip with Cityrama that included an illuminations tour and champagne and they even drop you back at your hotel afterwards, it's not cheap but then again nothing else was either. If your doing a shortlist of 10 city breaks to take then Paris should be on it, simply because it's Paris, but no higher than number 10, go to Rome instead. Everything in Paris is very expensive compared to other cities and that includes travel, the train from the airport to the closest metro was roughy 13 Euros each. We travelled a very similar distance when we went to Rome, the trains were the same and the trip was 1 Euro each. To sum up, a really nice hotel that is let down by the city that it's in, had it been in a nicer area and closer to the main sights I would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “We were not let down”
Reviews.Author: JonHackett
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for a week in July/August and after reading about every single review I had a pretty good idea of what this place would be like and it didn't let me down. I'll start off with the pros and cons. Pros: Nice place, clean, good breakfast, close to metro station (Jacques Bonsergent, Gare de l'est), nice style inside, and offers a warm atmosphere. Cons: A little far from the middle of the city and isn't within walking distance to any main attractions, rooms are a bit small (compared to hotel rooms in NA). Before looking too much into the pros and cons, bear in mind that they're entirely dependent on what you plan on doing in Paris. I expected a small room so I wasn't disappointed, and I knew where it was so I was expecting a short trek to the middle of the city. My girlfriend and I were both very pleased with the hotel and it provided us with exactly what we needed; a clean place to sleep before heading back out to the city. If you want to relax in a hotel room for 3 days then maybe this isn't where you should be going. So all in all, for the average tourist like me, it's a great place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: B88F77
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom were here only for a 3 day trip. This hotel was a very good choice. Staf was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and every day was filling tee, coffee and suger. Thanks to hotel it was a beatiful trip. If we would back to Paris, for sure to the hotel Magenta!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Entrance, Extremely Friendly Staff, Clean Toilet but very small room.”
Reviews.Author: Noshe
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during our 3 day vacation in Paris. The hotel is 5 mins walk from Gard Du Est station and well located. The hotel reception staff is very friendly. We stayed in Paris for only 3 days and the staff at the reception helped us plan the days so that we can get most out of our stay in Paris. I would give star points to the staffs for their friendliness and cooperation. The rooms are a bit small and they have used dark color carpet and big furniture so the room even looks smaller. The lift, staircase & passages are also very small. The small room didn’t bother us much as we were out most of the time and only returned to hotel for sleep. The bathroom is also very clean. So would recommend for those you will be out sight seeing most of the time. If you want to relax in the hotel, then this one is not a good choice as the rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “If you're not a pompous git, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: clickclick23
Reviews.Content: I always use this site, but never write reviews. But I felt compelled to after my stay at this hotel. I am always baffled as to some of the comments people put on here, so let me put it in my simple terms... Hotel was excellent. Granted, a little pricey for what you get, but just make sure you book it through a good website (lastminute.com etc), where I had it half price, and it was ACTUALLY half price. And besides, what do you expect? You're going to Paris! Don't listen to the people who say that it's miles away from the attractions and sights...if they had opened their eyes they would have seen the Metro and ridiculously cheap hire bikes that are simply amazing! Pick them up at one location, drop them off at another, do what you need to do, pick another one up at a different station. Truly a great idea! And going on the Metro is part of going to Paris! Also unbelievably cheap. There are several cracking restaurants and bars within spitting distance of the hotel. In fact, there is one DIRECTLY OPPOSITE that had lovely traditional live French music at the weekends, and the staff were superb. And about 5-10 minutes’ walk away we found an amazing market place on the Sunday, full of fresh vegetables, cheese, wine, seafood, anything you could wish for. The hotel is a weird pink colour, but I found that fun and a little quirky. The lift is small and maybe a bit slow, but come on, USE THE STAIRS if you have to! The rooms can be a little noisy if you're on the main road side, but I found it more of a hustle and bustle of Paris than an annoyance. I couldn't find the hotel when I got there, so the receptionist came outside to look for us...how many hotels in London would do that?!?! I said I would recommend....so there, I did it! Go. And don't listen to the moaning so and so's on here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting and overpriced and should be rated as a 1 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Getto3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews and were misled. The carpet was filthy, worn and old and the whole hotel had a nasty smell. We didn't bother eating the free breakfast because the basement that it was served in was not appealing and in fact was awful! I would recommend that you look elsewhere. The only positive aspect was the female front desk clerk was amazing! She really went out of her way to help us. We had booked for 3nights but checked out after the first night because it was too late to get another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FINE FOR A RATHOLE”
Reviews.Author: tumppi23
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is very, very, overpriced. It came to us as a surprise that our 1 year old baby's being in hotel with us costed 20 euros more per night, we had paid beforehand on internet for 4 nights in the hotel. We also heard from receptionist that breakfast is not included this price and we have to pay per day 9 euros per adult if we want to eat breakfast there (and camoon this 9 euros was somekind of "summer reduction", normally the daily adult breakfast price would have been 15 euros). Cost of 4 nights visiting in hotel was from 2 adults 419 euros and for our baby when arriving to the hotel we had to pay that 80 euros extra (still she slept between us in the same bed). Any services wasn't included on hotel room's price, except internet connection. The environment of the hotel was dirty and bleak, and distances to sightseeings were way too long even if we would been travelling just the two of us. There wasn't any shops near of us and only desent restaurants were two italian places on the area. The hotel interior was poor and the elevator was very very slow. Our view from the hotelroom window was backyard garpages. The carpet of the room was dirty or it looked like that, it might have been beaten-up... The professional photos taken from the hotel on booking site and everywhere are far hoax. The day when we were leaving from our hotel we asked the reception to call us a cab to the airport. We got the cab on time but the trip to airport was a complete catastrophe. The driver was very rude and intimidating by his gestures and we were late from our check-in at the airport. We informed the hotel staff via email of this driver but they did nothing to help us make a complain to the taxi company of a rude driver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but away from main city....”
Reviews.Author: DineshGaba
Reviews.Content: Hi, We were a family of 8. (Yes 8 people). Had taken 3 rooms. 2 on triple sharing and 1 on double. Located on Boulevard Magenta is this hotel. Before I get to the rooms let me cover the location, food and service. The check in time is 2:00pm. On arriving early u will be requested to palce ur bags in the bags room till the time is up and the room is ready. The hotel is located at a 10mins walking distance from Gar de l'Est Train Station which gives it good accessibility but if u compare to main city Paris it felt a little distant. Yes the metro service is accessible and thats what we used to take but still would have preferred a Hotel more centrally located. There are no porters being a 3 star property so all the luggage carrying will have to be done by oneself. The elevator is small but alrite. In reference to the food there is the eating area in the level -1 (basement). Over there the breakfast is served every day in the morning. On weekends its from 7:00am to 11am on weekdays breakfast is served between 6:00am to 10:00am (As far I can remember). For breakfast u have the cold cuts along with scrambled egg, a lot of preserves, juices, tea, coffee and yes of course croissants. The staff was accommodating. (On us asking to carry a couple of small bottles of jam that were made available for breakfast for on road comsumption while traveling to the next city of stay they were very kind and allowed the same). Now moving onto the rooms. The rooms are small. If its a triple occupancy then there are some compromises to be made. In our room while we were 2 of us there was no place to keep 2 suitcases. What a struggle. The rooms were clean. However there definitely can be some more space atleast for bags. Also the tap water is the drinking water. Please not expect any bottles of water to be provided in the room. Overall on rooms I rate the Hotel 2.5/5. On location 3/5. On service 3.5/5 . Can certainly choose this hotel as a place to stay however i suggest a more centrally located hotel and which has a little more space to at least accommodate 2 people comfortably. Cheers, Dinesh.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: esperant
Reviews.Content: I picked this place because it was close to the Gare du Nord, though I think this was a misjudgment, since we were there for a while, and the immediate neighbourhood is just not very interesting. The hotel itself is nice enough. Free internet is good, and the staff are fantastic, though it's pretty no frills. We had a couple of issues with our room, which was cold, and my girlfriend thought it smelt bad (though I didn't notice!). They moved us up to a much nicer room when I complained though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Convenient - excellent base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: sparkleytraveler
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I just spent time in Paris and stayed at this hotel. We had actually booked a deal through VoyagePrive.com that included hotel AND flights... I'd never booked a trip through a flash sale site before and didn't know the hotel or the airline but the offer was too good to refuse ($580 each!) so we just darn well booked it! I was a little nervous about what it might be like but I checked reviews of the hotel on TripAdvisor and saw that they were all quite positive, so we felt a bit more confident about our last-minute decision. (We also spent time at some other AMAZING Paris hotels - Park Hyatt Paris-Vendome, Pavillon de la Reine and Pavillon des Lettres - and while Hotel Magenta is certainly not on the same level as those, it was perfect for our needs at the time.) We arrived at CDG airport and took the train to Gare du Nord. It was just a 10min walk from there to the hotel. We had arrived super early and were crossing our fingers that by some stroke of luck our room would already be ready. Well, it was! We had booked a standard double room. We hoped that it might be two single beds pushed together to make a double, alas it was not but it wasn't a big deal. The room itself was pretty tiny but it was clean, bright and airy. There were double glass doors/windows that looked out over an interior courtyard, which got a lot of light and fresh air. The bed was comfortable, the linens were clean. The bathroom was small but clean and had a good shower. The closet had a good number of coat hangers, a mini bar, and a safe. It didn't really matter that the room was small though, we barely spent any time there as we were were up early and to bed late each day exploring the city. It was amazing to have free wifi at the hotel! They do have an iMac in the lobby for guest use but we had a laptop, an iPad, and two iPhones between us so we didn't make use of it. Included in our deal was daily breakfast, which is served in the basement. Nothing fussy or fancy, a simple but good buffet-style breakfast with bottomless baskets of fresh bread, croissants and pain au chocolat, sausages and scrambled eggs, cold meats, cheese, cereals, coffee/tea, and apple and orange juices. There is the option of having your breakfast delivered as room service but we chose to go downstairs for it. At one point we realized we needed a US power adaptor and decided to ask at the front desk before going to buy one... Good thinking because they pulled out a box of adaptors for every country you could think of. As my headline suggests, this hotel is an excellent base from which to explore Paris. Montmartre is just a 20-minute walk, and the Marais district is about the same. There are two Metro stations very close by... Jacques Bonsergent is the closest at just 2 blocks but it only has one metro line. About 7mins walk is Place de la Republique and the station there offers access to several different metro lines. Exploring the city is a must, but the neighborhood that the hotel is in is great too. Set pretty much in the heart of the 10th arrondissement, it is very close to the canal which is lined with cute bars and restaurants. We ate at one of them on our last night in town, which I actually found after a quick search on TripAdvisor, it's called Les Enfants Perdus. It had great reviews and was just a 3 minute walk from the hotel, so we decided to check it out. It was great! Quaint and cozy, yet chic. The glowing reviews that others have posted about it are spot on. The food was absolutely delicious, and not only were the waiters very helpful and gracious but they were pretty delicious-looking themselves! Check-out is at noon but we only needed to leave for the airport at 4pm, so we got ourselves packed up early and the hotel had no problem letting us store our luggage with them while we went out and about. Later we came back and grabbed our bags, changed into our outfits for the plane and relaxed in the air conditioning for about half an hour before we made the 10min walk back to Gare du Nord. We both agreed that we would stay at Hotel Magenta again. If you're on a budget but want something clean, comfortable and convenient, and plan to be out exploring the city a lot, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Ticked All The Boxes”
Reviews.Author: lorrcamp
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 nights in Paris and The Magenta was great..... next to the underground so was ideal from the eurostar and to get around the city in our limited time.... The buffet breakfast was freshly made and set us up for our day. We would recommend this hotel and when we return to Paris we'll be staying here again....... Paris was everything you can imagine.... Fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, what you see is what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Chrisovalantia
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our choice to stay at the Magenta hotel in Paris. I searched several hotels before I booked this one and there were more bad reviews than good ones around so it took me a long time to decide on this one. We werent disappointed at all. The hotel looks exactly the same as the photos (I've had experiences in the past where the photos look almost completely different from the real thing!) We arrived early evening to be greeted by a very pleasant man at the front desk who spoke both English and French which was handy. The check in was smooth and we reached our room within no time. There are four floors in the hotel and one lift. The room was lovely and clean and the bed was very comfy. We opted for the queen size bed which was a great choice. Tea and coffee making facilities were included in the room also. We had a room at the back of the hotel so it was nice and quiet. The hotel is placed on main road so not sure what the noise level would be at night but even during the day I couldnt hear the traffic whilst sitting in reception. There were "balcony" type doors which was nice too because we could get some fresh air instead of just turning on the air conditioning. Satelitte tv with french channels mostly and a couple of English ones too. Room service is available, wake up calls etc. A buffet breakfast and free wifi was included in our deal (we booked through expedia). Breakfast was very nice, a wide choice - eggs, sausages, rolls, croissant, pastries, cereal, juice, tea, coffee etc so something for everyone. The hotel is placed in a great location. Only a 10 minute walk from the Gare du Nord station. The nearest metro is Jacques Bonsergent (5 min walk) which made it very easy to get around. The hotel staff were very helpful is giving us tips on where to eat, visit etc. Overall a great choice and I would highly recommend to other travellers. We stayed for a total of 2 nights and we had everything we needed for the duration of our stay. Enjoy :0)

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: thevulch
Reviews.Content: I can find no bad points. everything was great.room was clean, bed very comfy. excellent shower and fluffy towels. very well situated for all main tourist sights, 10 to 15 mins walk from gard de nord.Its an easy walk and see no need for metro or taxi. millions of cash machines all down the boulevard.the hotel itself is very nice. i was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. all in all highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: thundervolt
Reviews.Content: We are returning this year to this hotel. It has very good service, the whole place is clean and the rooms are quite comfy, the breakfast came included in our reservation and it was very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room for a city like paris”
Reviews.Author: LoveGelati
Reviews.Content: I had a double room here. it was spacious and clean. the bed was extremely comfortable and was a proper double/queen bed (ie not 2 single ones put together)service is helpful and pleasant. breakfast is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service, but needs better soundproofing and the floodlights outside the windows turned off”
Reviews.Author: codsallStourbridgeUK
Reviews.Content: The Magenta was one of many hotels suggested as part of a rail/hotel package we were booking via Eurostar. We checked a number of the hotels that came up this way on TripAdvisor and the Magenta came out the best in our price range. In fact we varied our travel dates so that we could stay there! We were not disappointed. Everything people have said about it below proved true for us. The staff was friendly and helpful. They spoke good English. The room was clean and warm and, although small, well provided. A couple of bonuses – some computers free to use on the ground floor and the inclusive breakfast. The latter was very good, a wide choice and the breakfast room pleasant and spotless. Will certainly stay there again and recommend it to friends. The location is fine. Two Metro stations are nearby. The closest is Jacques Bonsergeant, but Republique is close as well. Between them they give you easy access to most places. We bought two packs of 10 tickets, but unfortunately some of them did not work in the Metro barriers and had to be checked and changed at a customer service desk on one of the stations. The Lidl supermarket mentioned has in fact closed for refurbishment – unit March 2011 – but there is a local shop – Eds – opposite and a Carrefour Metro close to Republique Metro Station – which are fine.

Reviews.Title: “attractive comfortable hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: clare1006577
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the summer .We had a room on the 3rd floor at the front. The room was nicely decorated and well equiped. It was clean and everything worked.The reception staff were very welcoming and helpful , as were all of the staff we encountered during our stay. The location suited us very well- we were able to walk to most places we wanted to see and it was close (but not too close ) to the station.We took a night to get used to the noise from the street outside but loved the view from our window,The breakfast was really good with lovely pastries and breads, cheese and cold meats,scrambled eggs,cereal,toast,yoghurt,fruit salad .There was coffee,tea,hot milk.fruit juice and hot chocolate to drink.We will definitely stay at this hotel again next time we visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Windrider40
Reviews.Content: Hotel Magenta was as advertised. The rooms were very small but clean and affordable. The location had good access to all the sites via the metro but was a bit dodgy at night and at times, felt we needed to walk quickly back to the hotel from the metro station. Staff were fantastic and extremely helpful. Breakfast was good. Don't regret for a second staying here as it came as advertised but would probably look for something in a better more "touristy" neighbourhood next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stayin Paris”
Reviews.Author: Chrismary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights on a recent visit to Paris where we met up with relatives from Canada.The hotel was close to Gare de Nord and near to Metro stations. Although the area is not the best the hotel was very good. We had a really quiet room which was a reasonable size. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet had a good choice. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Gare de l'Est and Gare du Nord”
Reviews.Author: Saffronbee
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly. We arrived slightly early but were soon given a nice room facing an inner courtyard. Our room was reasonably quiet but we had to close the window occasionally as wafts of cigarette smoke would come in through the window from adjacent rooms. Air conditioning worked well. The bathroom was absolutely fine. Tea and coffee making facilities were provided in the room. We had been advised to get breakfast before or after the ‘rush hour’ of 9-10am which we heeded and promptly managed to get one of the tiny tables that were indeed in very short supply at breakfast. The buffet was perfectly adequate. The location is good for the Gare de l’Est or Gare du Nord, about 5-10 min walk, and there is a metro station very close by. There are also plenty of brasseries in the immediate vicinity. We found this a very convenient hotel for our stop over in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raj1975
Reviews.Content: Good standard hotel for Paris - Not in a tourist area - close to the Metro - Breakfast was good but not as good as other reviews. Some tips: Buy a week metro and bus pass for 28 Euro's. Few good cafes in the area's.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Shell201083
Reviews.Content: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!!!. I chose the hotel based on previous good reviews, however this was the worst night we have ever experienced before in a hotel, and one of the least value for money. The air-conditioning didnt work so we were very hot all night, the breakfast was very basic, and the management and hotel staff extremely arrogant, unhelpful and rude!!! They failed to provide our baby with a promised baby cot which was confirmed by phone before we booked and at an additional charge of 20 euros. On arrival at 9pm we were told they do not have one in the hotel (despite me calling prior to personally speak to someone and confirm before we booked the room), and their solution was a fold away single bed on wheels. As our son had no other bed, he was put to sleep in this and FELL OUT OF BED. Then at 2am, and then again at 3am with an upset baby (and his parents) we asked again downstairs at the reception for our promised baby cot - which they miraculously discovered and set up in our room at 3.15am, so we had 4 hours sleep all night. The managements response was "we did supply a baby cot, late but we did" they forgot to mention they offered only after my baby fell out of the alternative bed they supplied which was in no way suitable for a baby, and after 2 visits downstairs to reception requesting them at 3 o'clock in the morning. Needless to say our Paris experience was ruined due to our tiredness the next day because of this hotel and their lack of care and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “great last minute find”
Reviews.Author: laglick
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 weeks in France and spent our last two nights at Hotel Magenta. We booked very last minute as we were unsure of where our travels would lead us. We found the hotel on Expedia and checked it out on Trip Advisor before we booked. The room was perfect, small but clean and adequate. We got a very reduced rate and our room was upgraded when we arrived. The breakfast buffet was unbelievable with a large selection of breads, cereal, yogurt, fruit, eggs and meats as well as juice, tea and coffee. The front desk was helpful and advised us how to easily get to the airport using puiblic transportation. The hotel is close to Gare d'est and Gare Nord as well as close to a metro stop. There are several good Bistro in the area. We highly recommend this little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, clean, air conditioned stay in down town Paris. Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Iheartairconditionin
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris during an intensive heat wave. Our first night, we stayed in a different hotel, on the fifth floor with no air conditioning, and promptly checked out the next morning. The hotel Magenta offered a clean, well furnished room with fairly good air conditioning. After our sweltering first night, this place was a dream. While staying religiously true to its name "Magenta", the Hotel is classy and fashionably furnished. The staff was very friendly, spoke English, and was patiently willing to humor me as I tried my hand with French. The Breakfast was included, and was very good. With fresh croissants, sausage and ham, cheeses, cereal, tea and coffee, orange and grapefruit juice, fruit, and fruit preserves it was a great morning meal. While the price-tag isn't necessarily considered a steal, we found it to be a very good value, with next to no complaints. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to my dearest friends, and the like.

Reviews.Title: “Located near a metro stop (Jacques Besergent?) and Gard du Nord and Gard de Est”
Reviews.Author: squirreleesmom
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a trip that included Dublin, Paris and London We stayed at the Hotel Magenta for three nights. I didn't really like the location in the 'historical Marais district' but it was easy to get around and the metro stop was very close along with convenience stores and the train station. We were generally back to our room by 10 pm and didn't partake in the nightlife in this area. Hotel was good for the price we paid and one of our rooms faced the busy Boulevard Magenta with a Brazziere right across the street. We (four of us) thought the breakfast was very good and didn't expect such a big selection. Everyone is still raving about the delicious croissants and breads that they served. They also had scrambled eggs, sausages,cheese, yogurt, fruit salad, cereals, juices, etc. It was all very tasty and I can't imagine why anyone would complain about the selection and quality. The hotel has computers (3-4) set up throughout the lobby for guests to use, no charge. I would recommend that you cover your password when you login as security cameras are overhead. The room had an odd configuration with two hallways within the room but the view from our room was good with two large windows that opened to a small balcony. Watch our for channel surfing on the t.v. as one channel was XXX and not appropriate for our eyes. We had a fire alarm one night around 3 a.m. The alarm woke me from a dead sleep and we took the winding staircase down four flights in our pajamas and didn't see anyone else until we got to the lobby. Two fire trucks came and did their thing, apparently a "fuse" blew and created a small flame. We returned to our rooms about a half hour later and had trouble going back to sleep. We all ended up sleeping in til 10:30 am, luckily we we didn't need to catch the Eurostar until 2 pm. I don't think I would stay here again just because of the district and it seemed a little rundown in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient, relaxed and totally chilled out Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Masterplan
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Paris before and when I book holidays I always find great deals...in this case I did not fail! I booked my trip includive of eurostar and hotel and paid £400 for 5 nights for 2 of us (includive of breakfast)!! I saw the individual prices inside the hotel per night and was shocked to find I had got an amazing deal!! This hotel has absolutely the best location!!! Reason I say this is due to a few reasons: 1. All the centre of Paris shops/restaurants charge higher prices for everything 2. There are 4 metro stations within 5 minutes walk of the hotel (nearest is literally 1 minute). The metro in Paris is amazing, better than the London Underground as it runs every 2 minutes and you can get to absolutely anywhere in Paris by buying a single metro ticket (£1) 3. There are restaurants everywhere from expensive Indian's to McDonalds or Subway within 5 minutes walk! 4. Lots of small supermarket shops which are great for bulk buying drinks, etc and storing in the hotel fridge! 5. Hotel is absolutely silent when inside, whether a party is going on outside or its raining, you feel relaxed and at ease. In the main central hotels, you have a lot more hustle and bustle of the city The hotel also has some great features such as free wi-fi, buffet breakfast which is perfect as the croissants are amazing and all the carbohydrates you consume, can be easily burned off from walking around the city. The staff were extremely freindly, spoke great English and were always polite...I must say...French people are probably these politest people I have ever come across in Europe!!! Always offer to help and every sentence has a please and a thank you!! Along with the Hotel, i loved the main sights of course, but the shopping centre the hotel helps to promote is definitely worth a visit - Galleries Lafayette (though a lot of the things there are much more pricier than buying on Champs Elysees). This shopping centre looks like a palace from the inside!!! Beautiful. Some handy tips: 1. When using the metro for the 1st time, buy a book of 10 metro tickets (works out to £1 per ticket) as opposed to a single ticket, which works out to £1.60 2. Be prepared to walk a lot of steps when visiting the Arc de Triomph 3. Go to a supermarket - Lidl is round the corner to the hotel and is dirt cheap for drinks and snacks! 4. When shopping for souveniers, shop around as so many shops have the same goods all at different prices - e.g. I bought a mug for 3.90 euros, but was in another shop for 9 euros! 5. Go on the 1 hour sightseeing cruise along the river Seine at the Eiffel Tower - BUT go at night for the 10pm departing time. Seeing Paris at night is much more breath taking and when you see the Eiffel Tower light up and flash, you'll realise you made a good decision on the late cruise! 6. Wear very comfortable footwear - trainers or flip flops and when walking, be prepared to get blisters if you make the mistake of wearing the wrong footwear! I'll leave the rest of the journey for you to experience, but all in all I absolutely, fantastically loved my trip to Paris, was 1 of my most favoured trips ever!!! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “It looks better in the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Maz190383
Reviews.Content: i thought this was a budget boutique hotel, but it isn't. the pictures (and the color / interior design of the lobby) can be misleading. it is basically a basic hotel, with basic rooms, basic breakfast. But it is clean, quiet and with friendly stuff. My opinion is that is a bit expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, don't rely on the website's pictures”
Reviews.Author: karine2307
Reviews.Content: Nice hote, nice staff. Location is ok, very close to the subway, but far from the center of the city. We had booked a premium room, and on the picture, it looked spacious. But it was not in the least, even for european standard... The main downside: no AC. At all. During the whole week. We asked them about it, said that it was the whole hotel that had no AC and that somebody was supposed to come and turn it on, but it was never done. We had to sleep with the window open, and our room was on the side of the street. I have no problem sleeping with all the noise from the street, but my mother slept very badly. Anyway, it was clean, we had a really nice view from our room. We had a deal with the flight company, so it was a good value, but I think the price they usually charge is overated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable rooms. Nice staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: pro-travelguy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, especially if you want to get away from the more touristed areas. Great breakfast, great internet access, nice staff. Would use this hotel again. Metro stop just in front and left,

Reviews.Title: “Very purple, comfortable, and nicely located”
Reviews.Author: ms_scotsgirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Magenta is extremely purple in its decor. Our room was small but comfortable, and the en suite had a bath. All clean, and nicely presented. The highlight was breakfast in bed, which was included, and involved coffee, juice, croissants, pan au chocolat and yoghurts. And it's within 2 minutes of the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have picked a better hotel if I'd tried!”
Reviews.Author: pinkbutterfly3
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip on Lastminute.com and have never been to Paris before (let alone travelled anywhere by myself before!). The hotel is actually only about a 15min walk from Gare de Nord station, it was daunting stepping out of the station into the unknown as the area is just like Oxford Street and I did go wrong a few times but my best advice is dont be afraid TO ASK people - I asked plenty and received a friendly reception! Hotel Magenta is in the heart of the bustling area but once inside, you could not hear a thing outside. Modern, spotless, friendly, safe (which was really important for me travelling alone - 24 hour reception staff and surveillance) central location - everything you could possibly ask for from a hotel. If you have found a deal that includes this hotel and Eurostar then go for it! To stay at the hotel independantly you will pay an awful lot more and I was shocked at the rates for one night so I was over the moon that not only was it perfect but I got a bargain too!! 100% recommend this hotel. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time During Our 30th + Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: PrincessMagnolia
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the hotel but we were informed that they can keep our luggage safely until the required check in time. Staffs incl. the housekeepers were very courteous and friendly (always had smile on their faces, makes us feel very welcome). Room for couple is just enough since we only need it for sleeping. All day till midnight we were out exploring the city. Very good location, accessible to nearby stores and walking distance to most tourist spots, 10-45 mins walk. Breakfast was the best we ever had and good choices even for weight watcher. Will definitely choose this hotel next time we go back to Paris. We've been recommending this hotel to our friends for cost and accessibilitity

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jensjeremies
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Magenta for 5 nights in February 2010. The hotel is 2 mins (literally) walk from the Jacques Bonsergent metro stop (Line 5) on the Boulevard de Magenta. It is also between 5 and 10 mins walk from Place de Republique in one direction and Gare de l'est in the other. We found the location to be ideal. We had a double room which was quite small but contained everything we needed. The rooms are quite modern and are kept very clean by the staff who come in daily. The bathroom contained a shower - quite powerful. There were tea & coffee making facilities, television and free WIFI. There is also Free internet in the hotel reception area. We stayed Bed & Breakfast and the breakfast is the best we've ever experienced on a European city break. There was cooked items (eggs & sausages), cereal, cooked meats, cheese, bread and lovely fresh pastries. A really good selection. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We arrived quite late on our first night and ventured out to find a restaurant. We spotted a wee trattoria across the road call Da Mimmo. It didn't look like much but it was really busy at 10pm on a Thursday evening so we thought we'd try it. It was FANTASTIC! The pizza was great and the Buffalo Mozzarella amazing! We went 2 nights out of the 5 it was so good! Overall we found Paris quite expensive but it is a lovely City and we would definitely recommend Hotel Magenta to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: portorl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quiet and clean. Rooms were small. We had a double bed, a desk and one chair. Not much room to walk around. You would not want to spend much time in your room. Location was okay. Neighborhood was safe - 10 minute walk to Garde lest. Several grocery stores located within 5-10 minute walk. Front desk help was spotty. 2 of the 4 people we encountered were cheery and very helpful. The other 2 need to find a new job - bad mood and very limited English.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recomended”
Reviews.Author: Minxie28
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 nights at Hotel Magenta. From the outside it looks nice, step inside and you are greated by friendly staff and a lovely interier. We had a tripple room which had lots of space. 5 minute walk to Gard de L'est and around 15 minutes to Gard de Nord. The hotel was clean and our bedroom was at the back of the hotel meaning it was lovely and quiet. Breakfast was fairly basic but what you would expect for the price range of the hotel. The food was lovely and you could help yourself. Staff very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. One point to note about the area - If you like Indian food you will be spoilt for choice. I do not enjoy Indian food and to top it off I am a vegetarian so did have to search hard for a resturant. A lot of Japanes resturants and kabab bars around also.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, clean, hot water, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: summerjt
Reviews.Content: I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you're on a budget but want a clean room, hot water and decent breakfast, which to be honest you're unlikely to get in Paris without spending quite a bit of money. This hotel is GREAT value for money. I've stayed in some dives in Paris, and this is certainly not one of them. Clean room, (though very small), furniture a little "worn". Bed not the most comfortable I've ever stayed in, but I slept OK. Bathroom clean, plenty of hot water. Breakfast was fantastic. Buffet style, plenty of everything, really worth the money if you manage to get a B&B deal like I did with lastminute. Newspapers available at reception. Free wifi internet, which is a rarity.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round”
Reviews.Author: StitchN16
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic room and good service. Tea making facilities, free wi-fi throughout hotel. For 3 stars we were very pleasantly surprised. We'll be back again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value but ask for an interior room”
Reviews.Author: Chahndra
Reviews.Content: Rooms were fine, bed comfortable, tea/coffee, flat screen, and free internet was great! Breakfast is quite good (and I know good croissants! as I live in France). Tons of business people stay here and they've got TV in the breakfast rooms (Ok, I like that). A fun little hotel but whatever you do, you need an internal room. Even though the windows are double paned, the street noise is horrendous. I actually had to go buy earplugs. They were full up too so couldn't change rooms and had coworkers who had internal rooms - slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “cheap & cheerful”
Reviews.Author: iceland_poppy
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for a long weekend sight seeing in paris i spent very little time in the hotel and for that reason booked somewhere that was cheap the communal areas in the hotel were nicer than i had expected (and very magenta!!!) but i was a little dissappointed with the room - i felt like there had been a big bed and they had taken it away and left a little bed which left big gaps between the bed and the bedside tables (which were fixed to the wall).....like they were teasing me with the thought of the lovely big bed that had been there. the rest of the room was basic but clean, it was compact but there was enough room to move around - i also had a room at the front of the building so had lovely big windows the breakfast was great for such a cheap hotel - tasty pastries...yum the hotel is fairly central and has 3 metros really close by the area the hotel was in felt like it bordered an area that wasnt great - i was with a friend and we both said we wouldnt have felt safe coming back from gare du l'est if we had been on our own - there is a nearer metro but on a line that we didnt come back on at night all in all a great value hotel that is idea for a city break, but im not sure i would have wanted to stay there for a whole week

Reviews.Title: “Very un-professional!”
Reviews.Author: CatRo
Reviews.Content: I booked a room yesterday. Today they sent an email saying that my reservation was cancelled because the credit card was refused. I work for a big corporation, of course my credit card was just fine. I wanted to remake the reservation, but...surprise the hotel room costs 170 EUR more! I called the hotel and their only explanation was that there was nothing I could, I have to pay 170 EUR more, if I want to make the same reservation! At any other hotel they would have appologised for this and re-book the room for the same amount, AT LEAST! I wondered how would they behave at the front desk...they won't even recognise the booking rate? I wouldn't be surprised!!! For sure, I won't go there anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Clean easy and good value”
Reviews.Author: GreyNomadsouthbucks
Reviews.Content: Hotel two Metro stations from gare du Nord 3 stars is a slightly over the top Room clean bathroom fine with large towels and ashower that worked well. Wireless in the room for free

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: PaderoIzza
Reviews.Content: I saw the cleaning lady washed the coffee cup on the bathroom sink and wipe the cup with the towel laying on the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, close to main metro stations...what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: bobaloo17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our very first trip to Paris, and I'm very glad that we chose this hotel. The room was small, but cozy, and more than sufficient for the small amount of time that we spent in it every day. The fact that it is within very easy walking distance of both the Gare De L'est and the Gare Du Nord was a bonus, as the Jaques Bonsergent station (the closest metro station to the hotel) was closed on our last day, so we ended up having to walk our luggage to the Gare De L'est to get to the airport. The part of town that it is located in isn't the greatest, but even walking around later at night, I didn't feel too threatened. There is a great little restaurant right on the corner, and a couple of nice bakeries nearby. The staff are courteous and very very helpful, and the breakfast served every morning is delicious; it will give you a great start to every day that you spend in Paris. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for accommodations away from the congestion and higher cost of the main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rendesvouz99
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located, close to major train stations. Takes about 30 minutes to get there from the Eurostar terminal using trains. Clean, spacious rooms. Showers a little on small side. Loved the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.....uncomfortable neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: kccChicago
Reviews.Content: If you could transplant this hotel, in say, the Rue Clere area of Paris...you would have a winner. But, aside from the fact this is a clean, friendly, roomier than most hotels, the surrounding neighborhood is a disapointment. Day time seems safe enough, and the metro is very close by...one pretty good resturant on the corner..and a super bakery about a block away.( right by the metro entrance) But after sunset the atmosphere changes, and it just does not seem safe. I would not recommend this hotel for women traveling alone or seniors. If Taxi's are in your budget, maybe. Young travelers would probably be just fine. They also offer a great breakfast (included in room fee), and there are a few computers available in the lobby. You must take some sort of transportation to get to the center of the city. I have to say, the staff were very helpful...and we enjoyed everything "inside" the hotel. One more thing, if your room is on the top floor..the "lift" stops one floor below. You must drag your luggage up a spiral staircase to the top floor...interesting!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for price - Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GONZALEZLima
Reviews.Content: Location is not the best ( very close to Gare de l´est). staff is friendly however we arrive at 10:00am and the had to wait until 2:30 pm to have our rooms. Rooms are small but clean. There is avaialble WiFi in all hotel. Breakfast is good for hotel / price, then this hotel is a good choice of low budget in Paris. There is a reaturant in the corner of this hotel that food is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel that is conveniently located close to RER station”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: My 5/5 rating does not mean that this is a perfect hotel. What it does mean is that it's great value. I booked this as a flight + hotel package trip through a popular website (I know that I cannot give the name here because Tripadvisor will only remove it). Pros: * It's walking distance from the Gare du Nord RER train station (about a 10 minute walk). It was even closer than we thought - so close in fact we walked well past it. I knew I was looking for a magenta-coloured hotel with flags out front. What I didn't know is that the trees on the street hide much of the hotel when approaching from the other side of the street. Also, it's pretty painless to get from the Roissy airport to Gare du Nord station by their RER commuter train, and it takes about 45 or so minutes. * The free breakfasts was a tremendous bonus, especially given the variety. It was great having pulpy orange juice and coffee every morning. They have different types of breads (including dinner rolls), chocolate croissants, cold cut meats, sausages, scrambled eggs, cereals with milk, yogurt, cheese wedges, and grape fruit juice. With the dinner rolls and cheese you can make sandwiches for lunch. The eating area is in the basement. It is surprisingly spacious and welcoming. Even when there was a lot of people, there were always enough seats. And the have flat-screen TV's mounted on the walls. * Staff/Service - I was impressed with the consistently great service. No matter who was working the desk, service was excellent. I would always have a question about directions, and front desk was always obliging. After approaching front desk about the fan in my room that did not work, she made sure it was fixed for when I got back. They were kind about lending a plug-in converter with a 10 EUR deposit. I really enjoyed their front desk candy dish, which was always filled. And they kept the breakfast eating area very clean, even when it was busy. * I've read that this hotel was renovated last year, and it shows. The lobby is quite nice, and modern. And the rooms feel somewhat new, and clean. * Other perks: having the bar fridge in the room is extremely handy. I was able to enjoy cold beer every evening (which we purchased in local markets). And it is great to have free wireless internet, with an excellent connection. * Price - take into account the cheap price, given all the above-mentioned pros, and this is a sweet deal. Again, keep your eyes open for this hotel in package trips on popular discount travel websites. We even had direct flights each way. Cons: None of my cons are significant, really. * The room was a bit small, which is expected in the older buildings of Paris. We were in room 610, and I could see from the floor plan posted on the door that there were some rooms that were even smaller. We were facing the courtyard, which is what I needed for a guaranteed good sleep. * It's true that the elevator is strange. It does not seems to work on one pick-up at a time. My wife thought that holding the button down helped (so that it would not pass your floor completely if someone else hit the button before you did). We ended up taking the stairs a few times because of its slowness. * Location - while the hotel is not in the prime tourist locations, it's close enough. For those that love to walk, it's perfect. We had a whole week in Paris, so we did not mind walking almost everywhere. With such an intricate subway system, it's still a great location for those that don't want to walk so much. The furthest attractions from this hotel are the Eiffel Tower and the Arch de Triomphe. Some sites not so far away by foot include Sacre Coeur, Montmartre, Pere Lachaise cemetary, Pompidou, and Notre Dame Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but poor location”
Reviews.Author: k0k0k0
Reviews.Content: Hotel is newly renovated with modern look, the triple room is clean but a bit small especially for the extra sofa bed, we cant open our luggage at same time, bath room is big than enough. Free Wifi and dvd player, the most happy thing is having the boiling pot for tea making. The breakfast is good with hot stuffs. But my friend complained "The Lift is the most stupidest lift she ever came across" because it seemed that it can only single tasked, say if someone press to 6/F first, then you press 3/F, the lift cant accept the order and just go straight to 6/F, what a funny thing!!! However the chief defect is the location, it is close to metro Jacques Bonsergent only with Line 5 can be there, and it took us more than 20 mins to walk to Gare du Nord with luggage, if you are shopping queen, it makes you exhausted when back to hotel or to the RER to Aéroport .

Reviews.Title: “Close to Metro, Good perks, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: laangelsfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Magenta for a couple days on a week long trip to Europe. I think this propriety is more likely a three star (as a variety of sites have it listed as a four star). There were some really good things about it: Free Wifi, Breakfast Included (and pretty comprehensive), and a good variety of channels on a lcd TV. Also the room was not tiny tiny as I am accustomed to when traveling in Europe, so that was also a perk but the room is very basic. The location will probably be hit or miss depending on the person. It certainly was not in the middle of the action, but it was conveniently close (2 min walk) to the Metro and from there, only a couple stops from the big train statons (Gare du Nord and Gare de le Est). Canal St. Martin is only a couple blocks behind the hotel so that may a perk for some others as well. The receptionist was very nice and spoke English which was a good perk and went out of our her way to help us find our way. Also a minor word of caution, but if you arrive at the hotel early and plan on checking your luggage, they give you a luggage room key that you yourself place your bags in, which then any one could access once they have the key. I was a little wary of leaving my bags in the room but had little choice as I wasn't going to drag them around the city. Also, one really nice and rare thing (at least for me) was that they gave you the choice of having breakfast delivered to your room instead of eating in the dining room at no additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: jcrichton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in July - our second visit as we had stayed in the Magenta in November last year. The renovations which had been ongoing then are now complete. The hotel still the same high standard as previous - clean spacious rooms; excellent staff and a excellent hot and cold buffet breakfast. The location is good with regard to both Metro and Railway stations and the Harmonie Cafe/Bar opposite the hotel does good value meals and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms but bad location”
Reviews.Author: FlissandCarlo
Reviews.Content: We chose to book Hotel Magenta after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. The building is a renovated Hausman building and so has some old world charm about it, however quite modern inside. The room we stayed in was clean but on the small side and the refurbishment was obviously done on the cheap side as it had a very new look but used modern shortcuts such as velcro-fixed wall hangings. Bathroom was clean and well maintained. Our room faced the courtyard (not street side) which is a plus as you don't get traffic noise. The view was ok - some distant graffiti but an interesting little insight into Paris. Beds were comfortable and clean. Lifts/elevator a bit slow and no more than two people with baggages or 4 people max. Often we found ourselves using the stairs especially when your in a rush. It also appeared to get stuck on a floor as we saw the hotel management running up the creaky old staircase a couple of times to try and resolve the problem. Getting to and from the hotel is ok but not the best - The closest major metro station is 'Republique' which is a good 5-10 min walk away and has lots of interconnecting metro lines, the station Jacques Bonsergent is closer but is a minor metro line which means you'll need to change stations unless heading to Montmatre. We walked from Gare du Nord to Hotel Magenta which is a good 15 min walk and a little tricky with wheely suitcases negotiating some major intersections. We suspect that someone may have had attempted to pickpocket us as one of our backpacks was unzipped when we arrived at the hotel. Front of House is just ok. The staff spoke english sufficiently and were able to check you in and give directions. Nothing special but meets your needs. The buffet breakfast is quite good. Selection consisting of juices, breads, ham, cheese fruit and pastries. There were also hot items such as scrambled eggs and a type of sausage. All in all the hotel was good place to stay but the 10th arrondissement and the Boulevards de Magenta has no attractions. For our whole stay the area did not feel safe, especially coming home late at night. Each night we saw homeless sleeping on the street and on a couple of occasions men urinating in the street. It seemed like the Boulevards de Magenta was just a thoroughfare to get to another district which made the surroundings a bit empty, run down, dirty and urban. Good value for the clean room and yummy breakfast but will not stay here again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and good quality”
Reviews.Author: DBOnline
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magenta in June 09 for 1 night and was pleasantly surprised. Big room with extremely comfortable bed in a spacious room (especially by parisan standards). Busy street but excellent soundproofing and air con make it perfectly fine. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: amish_boy_rich
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute holiday to paris and wanted to find a decent quality hotel that wasn`t hugely inflated in terms of price. The hotel Magenta fit the bill perfectly. It is situated within walking distance of the central atttractions although the nearby metro station may make it a little easier on your feet. There are also a multitude of small bars and cafes in the locality if you fancy taking it easy on a particular day. The hotel itself is just as billed online. It is stylish and modern with the rooms functional but not terribly plush; but then while in Paris why would you want to spend hours in your room anyway!! The breakfast was basic but set you up for the rest of the day. On the whole i have no bad words to say about the hotel. The location was spot on, rooms functional and breakfast good. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: APTravels
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend at this nice hotel. Very obliging reception staff especially Nicholas. Good bathroom with really big fluffy towels.
