The only downside was that the Air-con in our room couldn't cope with last weekend's heatwave but there was a very useful fan in the room. Breakfast was also pretty good. It was also great to have a fridge in the room and electric kettle so that we could make tea or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Asmussen
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, clean room, fine location/price relation. Breakfast OK. Quiet at night - at least when the room has windows towards the rearside of the hotel. Rather small room, but coffeemaker, and not at least, a refrigerator. Good value for money. Free internet form a PC at the reception. English speaking staff at the reception. Elevator was working OK. However strange, as it did have no memory, and no logic, so from 2'nd floor you could go the the reception via 6'th tfloor! When I arrived I was surprised that the room was pre-paid via "voucher". Which I had not been informed about at hotelguide.com. It seems to be more and more common. I thougt that only sites like hotels.com had did that. Not good. It is no advantage for me - or any other customer(?) - Too bad that the people who run the otherwise OK page hotelguide.com does this to earn their money via earning on the interest paid by customers, instead to ask the hotel to pay for the booking. - And let them include it in the cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ozzie-not
Reviews.Content: I took a gamble in booking this hotel for myself & 2 siblings and it paid off! - thanks to the positive remarks previously posted. We could not fault the location(close to railway stations/metro), cleanliness, very helpful & obliging staff who are English speaking, great breakfasts, access to internet & the general atmosphere of this hotel....we were quite at home here & feel we got true value for money. Our triple room was somewhat old fashion in its design but had been recently painted & was fresh & well appointed - a two room affair with hallway between. Main room had kingsize bed, toilet/shower, TV etc, the other a single bed, TV, toilet. We had 2 very comfortable nights here & wouldn't hesitate to make a return stay should we be so lucky!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bradley88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6 night stay at the Hotel Magenta and will have to say it was the best hotel we have stayed in in Paris. Spotless, someone always cleaning, superb service and staff help at the front deskwas always friendly and very pleasant. Best breakfast for a hotel, coffee, differents breads and croissants, cheeses, hams, cereals, yougurt and even hot eggs and sausage. The room was always spotless, along with all the common areas. The location was excellant with loads of restaurants, shops, cafes around. Easy access to major metros. Lively neighborhood. Hotel should be booked online for best rate. 5 pillows! and amazing comforter!!!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The only thing that happened was that the elevator was out of order a few times but thankfully we were only on the 4th floor. Our room was fantastic and very quiet facing the courtyard. Computers with internet access in the lobby at no charge.Thank you Hotel Magenta for making our vacation even more lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie630Belfast
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all - value for money, clean, good breakfast , quiet at night and ideal location for travelling into city centre as it is right beside the tube line. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for a city break”
Reviews.Author: paulswt
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and pleasant but the fact that I only needed to speak to them once outside of arriving and leaving was a good sign. My room was quiet, considering the elevator was opposite the door and occasionally you heard people chatting but it wasn't disruptive. The room wasn't huge but was comfortable. As mentioned on their website there's a safe with an electronic lock where you set your own pin code for it. I'd taken my laptop and the wifi was fine, really fast unlike English hotel chains where you have to pay for it and get a really slow connection speed. My laptop fitted in the safe with plenty of room and being able to lock my passport and money away too was nice. There's also a little guidebook in the rooms that explains how everything works, in French and English. They also have a luggage room downstairs so you can leave your bags there before check in or after you check out, and it's locked and secure so your mind is at ease. I only went for breakfast on the final day, but wish I'd made the effort to get up early and go down for the other 2 days - plenty of food, delicious, lots of choice and fresh, hot coffee which was delicious and nicer than any of the cafes I went to in the city! There was plenty of room as well for everyone to sit. A perfect start to the day. If I had one complaint it would be that the lift was out of order on one day, and I wouldn't have liked to carry my bags to the fifth floor but thankfully it wasn't the day I arrived. I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, modern hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: rufferta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here eight nights in late March and early April. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was, considering the reasonable rates. An unexpected extra was how helpful the front desk staff was when my husband had problems with his VISA card and when he lost his wallet. They didn't say "That is *your* problem" but helped him use their phone until he could get matters resolved. Another pleasant surprise was the breakfast buffet with a great variety of things like scrambled eggs, yogurt, pastry, etc.... The buffet had extended hours but nothing was ever "out of stock." Our flat-screen television had excellent reception and what seemed like an endless channel line-up. Beds were very comfortable. My husband especially appreciated the fact he could brew a cup of tea in the room. There was internet reception in the rooms, but if you hadn't brought your own computer there were three Macs in the lobby. They also offered free newspapers in three languages, and daily weather forecasts were posted. All in all, a very nice hotel for the value and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too small room”
Reviews.Author: Paris567
Reviews.Content: Very, very, very small room. And for the price, it is not really interesting. Some two stars and majority of three stars hotel in paris have better size room. Hotel clean, but as any hotel should be. Think you have to watch their promotion; it was a three days for the price of two; I got 2/3 of a room for three days at a price that was not apprpriate for that room!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Tourist101Montreal
Reviews.Content: We bought our 6 night stay with Air Canada Vacations, and we were really pleased. We requested for a Premium room, which came with a comfy king size bed with a fluffy feather-bed cover, a nice flat screen tv and a dvd player (but you're not there to watch tv!), and a clean and modern bathroom. At first, we were in room 303, facing Magenta Blvd, which is a bit noisy (it's fine as long as you keep the window well shut, but the AC isn't really cold so by the end of the night, you wished you could crack the window). So we requested to be transferred in a room facing the interior court, which they did as soon as there was one available. Room 508 was great, a little bigger, very quiet and with a full bathtub instead of a shower. There is a safe in the room (and in the staircase on the first floor) if you wish to leave your passport and other valuables. There's a luggage deposit (which is really useful since you can't check in before 3pm). The breakfast was nice: eggs, sausages, cereals, crescent rolls (of course!), other pastries, yogurt, bread, jam, fruit salad, 3 kinds of deli, 1 kind of cheese, orange and grapefruit juices, tea and coffee. Always replenish till the last minute, so no need to rush to get it (you can also request to have it delivered to your room). There is also a coffee/tea bar in the room. The fridge is big enough so you could keep some nice French cheese and pate for lunch. The hotel is well located, you can take the RER (suburb train for about 9 euros) from Charles-de-Gaules to the Gare du Nord (be careful there are some trains that are direct and some that stop at every station on the way) and then walk to the hotel. From the hotel, you can walk to many sites of interest, but I still advise to buy a Paris Visite pass which gives you unlimited access to subway, bus & train (zone 1 to 3 is enough if you want to stay in the hearth of Paris and don't planned to go to Versailles) and it also gives you a discount in a few museum such as the Opera Garnier and the Arc de Triomphe. There are about 5 subway lines that come near the hotel, so you can go wherever you want. The surroundings feel safe and we didn't have to leave our key at the front desk as some other reviews suggested. We enjoyed the free access to the Mac, and the entire hotel is wifi (as well as many restaurants, we noticed). There is a nice pub/restaurant 4 doors down with a red canopy (the steak tartar is really good!) Overall, I would recommend this clean and modern hotel with no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel, close to travel links”
Reviews.Author: MintTea
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now, after two other trips to Paris staying at inferior hotels. The Hotel Magenta is located about 15 mins walk from Gare du Nord and 10 mins from Gare de l'Est, it's easy to find and pretty much a straight walk. The area is a little rundown looking but this is par for the course in Paris and it's perfectly safe. Both times when I've booked I've then contacted the hotel directly asking for as big a room as possible. The first time I stayed my boyfriend and I had a lovely double room, small compared to UK hotels but large by Parisian standards! The decor is fairly modern and there's a flatscreen TV and DVD player in the rooms (tip: take some films with you if you don't want to watch French TV in the evenings). The second time I stayed I was given a room on the 7th floor, it was a hike to get to but a brilliant wee room up in the 'garrett', it had a great views out over the rooftops of Paris. Ask for a room on this floor if you want something a bit different and don't mind climbing the last flight of stairs (or more if the lift breaks down as it did when I was there!). Breakfast was included in our rate and is served in a little breakfast room in the basement. There is plenty on offer - croissants, cereal, toast, fruit, yoghurts, tea, coffee and juice - and is a help yourself affair. The staff are very friendly and speak excellent English but will also converse with you in French if you give it a go. A great feature of this hotel is that they have three or four Macs in the lobby which you can access the internet on and are free for use. There are also big comfy settees here too which you can lounge around on if you're waiting to check-in or leave for your flight. There is also a supermarket about 5 mins up the road which you can stock up on food and baguettes and cheese for your day trips, along with small boulangeries en route to the train station. This is a great hotel which I've always found a good rate at, the reception staff reply personally to your emails and the rooms are a decent size for central Paris. I'm already looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with a cosy and modern touch”
Reviews.Author: 100gita
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magenta for 3 nights with my wife. The location was excellent everyplace was at walking distance if you like walking. The elevator was not working when we arrived but was fixed within few hours the same day. The computer had problem with the keyboard, we mentioned at the reception and was fixed, was given an option as well. The bed sheet was fresh and clean. The staff was not necessarily chatty but was helpful when asked for. The breakfast area was kept clean and well refreshed through out. The staffs were discreet, over all it was good for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “All round good value”
Reviews.Author: groundhog51
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends for 4 nights using 3 rooms. Rooms a little small but comfortable bed and good showers. Staff were very helpful and speak excellent English. Good breakfast. Although Jacque Bonsergent is the nearest Metro we found it easier using Gare de L'Est. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You are definately paying for the location...”
Reviews.Author: Lulu99Winnipeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located right by Gare du Nord is very well located. There's tons of restaurants near by and you can hop a metro in minutes. The room wasn't great though, so the price is really for the location. The only good part about the room was the balcony. The bed was flimsy and low, the carpet was dirty and the pillows were aweful. One day we came back and had no shower curtain. They wouldn't replace it until the next day. They are not the friendliest and aren't very accomodating. Our room wasn't ready when we got there and they made us leave the key at the desk every time we left to go out (which is often). If you are looking for a decent room in a good location, this is the right place for you. Just keep your expectations low....

Reviews.Title: “Got my money back without question from the tour operator... thats how bad the Hotel Magenta was to us!”
Reviews.Author: KennyMARCH
Reviews.Content: A surprise birthday treat for me that was to go horribly wrong from the moment we walked in the door. Staff and manager were rude, unhelpful, arrogant and obviously making too much money collectively to care about individuals. If its faulty don't mention it and you will have a great time. If it cuts out when your using it then that's normal. If it was working before you arrived then dont question it and you will have a lovely time. And if breakfast is over 20 miutes before it is meant to finish, then thats your fault for not understanding how we do things here. The lift/elevator not working is also considered good exercise from the seventh floor too! Insults and unhelpful to the end and even after we were back in the UK we received seriously abusive allegations from the manager who became defensive, aggressive and intransigent against us and even the 'city break' tour operator! As I said at the beginning the booking agent, www.lastminute.com, refunded our money plus compensation without question as it was that bad. And they dont like to do that easily do they? Birthday postponed a year. Thank you Hotel Magenta.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great location”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliantly situated in the 10me arrondissment and right beside a metro station, Jacques Bonsergent. The room was at the back of the hotel, so was quiet, but was VERY small, which is ok if you only need a base. Great shower and free safe but only 1 English channel on TV [BBC world news], temperamental hairdryer, hard bed, expensive mini bar and mediocre breakfast. Waned to upgrade to a Superior room but they wanted e40 per night of our 3 night stay. Loved, loved, loved Paris but would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DinkyDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise! The staff were both friendly and efficient. The hotel was very close to the metro stations Jean Bonsergent and La Republique, which allowed for easy access around Paris. There were plenty of shops, restaurants, cafes and bakerys in the area - Maya was a very nice little restaurant nearby with friendly staff and delicious food! The hotel provides free use of a Mac with internet access in the reception area, which I thought was an excellent idea. There was also the possibility of room service for breakfast free of charge! The only complaint I woud have is that the rooms were very warm at night and the air conditioning didn't seem to work. Also if you are a light sleeper, request a room at the back of the hotel. We stayed on the first floor facing the road and it could be quite noisy at times. I would highly recommend the hotel for budget conscious travellers - make sure you don't pay the (over priced) standard rate of €188 per double room per night. We got a good deal on [--] I would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aenye
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 night in this hotel and I must say that I was positive suprised. Hotel is very close to Metro station and not far away from Gare du Nord and Gare do Est, so no need to get a taxi/tube to reach here. There is plenty small shops, bars/coffees around hotel and if you need cash maschine there is a one just a few feet from hotel entrance. We had a room on second floor, overlooking street and only one thing I dislike was traffic noises - it didn't stop at night. It wasn't too loud but as we're living in a small town I found it a bit annoying. We had comfortable standard double room with LCD tv, laptop safe and wi-fi access. There was a small fridge with soft drinks and if you want to do some small grocery shoppings you can easily put them there as well. Electric kettle, two mugs and two glasses were there together with some coffee/tea/sugar/milk sachets. If we use some of them it was repleaced by maiden. Bathroom was very nice, clean, it has a big shower and hairdryer. We haven't had any problems and staff in reception was very helpfull when we asked them about directions. Yes, they asked you to pay when you check-in but some other hotels do the same, so I didn't complain about that. Breakfast was good as for 3 star hotel. They haven't got any vegetables but there was youghurt, fruit salad, three types of cold meats, one type of cheese and some hot sausages and scrambled eggs. They had a fair enough selection of bread and pastry, cornflakes, and same with tea/coffee/chocolate/juice. The good thing is that you can order breakfast to your room. In overall, as for 3 star hotel, it was better than good. I didn't give 5 points in overall rating because of traffic noises, but if you want a reasonably priced hotel in Paris this one is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value especially for Paris”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker2008_7
Reviews.Content: Three stars are not our norm but this hotel certainly delivered on value. I was surprised to read another revie regarding the clean rooms. We never had an issue. In fact any minor issue we did have the staff were quick to assist. The breakfast was very good however its the same menu every day and after the third morning we were longing for a change, any change. It's too bad they don't do an evening coffee/tea/cookies it would certainly allow for guests to meet each other or find a gathering point. Location is perfect and just over the canal side a 7 minute walk are some good value restaurants. Our favorite and the most expensive in the area was Hotel Du Nord.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, decent enough though.”
Reviews.Author: RyanM240
Reviews.Content: Fairly small rooms, bout 7 or 800 yards from a metro station, neighbourhood fairly average, not bad little bar/cafe across from the metro station, apart from that the rooms are clean enough and staff friendly enough to make it an economical and fairly smart choice when picking a hotel in Paris, had no problems at all while I was there, as I was really only using for the bare minimm, never ate any meals etc in hotel. Fairly good, economical option when staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “absolute bargain! best deal i´ve done”
Reviews.Author: jarvester
Reviews.Content: got a lastminute deal for 275 pounds for 3 nights with breakfast. on arrival we were complimentary upgraded to a superior room, everything was spotless, excelent breakfast, nice location, free wifi... recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Heyerette
Reviews.Content: Having had a rather more awful experience during the first trip to Paris (also a 3-star-hotel close to Place de la Republique), we chose Hotel Magenta as the reviews sounded quite positive and the pictures posted promised value for money. No disappointments - of course the room was rather small, but this is Paris, but the deco was modern and pleasant, the room very clean and breakfast truly scrumptious, especially at such an affordable rate. Rooms to Boulevard de Magenta are a little on the loud side, but as such, the location was good - only a few minutes walking distance to Place de la Republique and a metro stop just a few metres away. Though we walked to PdlR most of the time - or elsewhere. Gare du Nord is nearby as well, though the area around it not exactly pretty. Definitely would stay at the Magenta again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience + staff attitude appalling. May be fine when all OK but cannot manage dealing with faults at all!”
Reviews.Author: 18k
Reviews.Content: PLEASE READ THIS: As seasoned travellers I have never come across anything like it ever. I always think a good test of any organisation is not how they cope when things are good but how they respond when there are problems. For this reason this hotel is absolutely appalling. Put on 7th floor with lift out of action for entire duration of trip. If you can cope with spiral staircase and one rickety rail for 7th flights of stairs and staff who would prefer to tell you to leave than fix a faulty TV and shower and hairdryer you'll love this place! Read all the reviews and thought like others it sounded just the place for my husbands birthday gift city break. Booked a premium room which turned out to be a pokey, dark attic room on the 7th floor (lift only goes to 6th). However told on arrival there would be no lift for entire stay. Only a spiral staircase with a single inside handrail. I found this terrifying as I do sometimes get vertigo but this was awful! Moved to room on 5th floor (still 6 flights up) TV- no reception, shower broken, all bathroom fittings insecure on wall including bath safety rail. Hairdryer shorted out after 50 seconds use, Breakfast staff unhelpful and rude. By the way breakfast finisheds at 10AM but if like us you've dealt with faulty shower, hairdryer and 6 flights of stairs and arrive later than planned at 9.45 AM don't expect any hot food left or that the staff will kindly find you some more! Reported faults with room - explained that I have to use an inhaler and 6 flights of spiral stairs not good and abruptly told by Kelly who told us that she is a just a receptionist (later told us she was the manager ?) that we can leave the hotel! No refund just go. We were made to feel like pariahs every time we requested or returned our key. There were lots of other problems with this place all could have been easily resolved with simple courtesy and a respect for paying guests but it's most definitely NOT the way Hotel Magenta likes to operate. Incidentally- the other reviewers did not mention that there is a closer metro to this hotel - Jacques Bonsergent - just 2 mins away. Probably because like us the hotel staff chose not to mention it even though we asked for the name of the nearest tube. We discovered it sadly on our last day after much unecessary walking. Also a word of warning - If a taxi driver tells you it's not worth taking you a short distance please insist or take his name and no. We were caught out this way and thought he was being kind by saying he didn't want to take our money when it was so close - we ended up walking for 20 mins with all our luggage to the hotel which would have been an 8 min cab ride. I've never written a review before as despite many travels have never felt this strongly before. I completely wasted my money and have returned feeling utterly devastated. I would hate anyone else to go through this. There is now a formal complaint lodged with lastminute.com re this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: KatieLM
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Magenta and loved every minute of it. We had a 'Deluxe Double' which had a Double bed and, interestingly, a single bed also. As there was only two of us this was not necessary or requested; however, it was not a problem in that the room was spacious anyway. The room had a clean and well equiped bathroom with a shower, toilet, basin etc. The room was cleaned every day. The bed was lovely and soft, and the bedding more than adequate. The hotel was well-located, right near the Jaques Bonsergeant metro stop. It is also within walking distance (about 15 minutes with luggage) from Gare de Nord and Gare de l-Est, making it very convenient. Despite this, we ended up walking most places anyway, but it was good to have this station for late nights and tired legs! The staff at the hotel were pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was very nice (scrambled eggs, small sausages, cold meats, pastries, cereals, juice, tea/coffee) and you are able to have it brought to your room if you choose - though you miss out on the hot food. Overall we had a really lovely time at Hotel Magenta and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: nikla1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked Hotel Magenta through lastminute.com for a bargain £90 per night including breakfast. Our stay was flawless from beginning to end. The staff are fantastic and couldn't be more helpful. Their English is brilliant if, like mine, your French has seen better days and they happily recommended a restaurant and gave directions when necessary. Our room had a balcony from which we could see the Sacre Cour and the top of the Eiffel Tower. The recent renovations mean that the rooms are spotless. We had a huge bathroom and a very comfortable bed. Finding the hotel is easy and the transport links very convenient. The breakfast is fantastic value with sausages and eggs included on top of the usual continental selection. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BadgerWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Was in Paris for work trip (Jan 20-23). Magenta is very clean and located quite conveniently to the subway (about a block away). Also one of the better continental breakfasts I've experienced. Room was quite an odd shape (had long hallway segmenting a first small bedroom and my bedroom and bathroom). Bathroom updates had to be done within past year or two, so very modern.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Treat”
Reviews.Author: Alamar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were meeting up with relations from Australia for a weekend in Paris. We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the apartment they were staying in and the good reviews it had received. I used some of my BMI airmiles to get a room upgrade. The hotel was well situated just a couple of minutes from the Place de Republique with all it's cafes, restaurants and major Metro station and a short walk from the Gare de l'Est. The staff were friendly, helpful and had good English which was just as well as my French is rudimentary "O" level at best, the hotel itself had been recently decorated and has a pleasant relaxed atmosphere with a lounge area and several internet stations in recesses. The room was very comfortable and well appointed with a super king size bed which was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in, the bathroom was modern with a bath/shower, wc, whb and hair drier and, unusually I've found for an hotel on the continent, provided a kettle, tea and coffee. There was also a flat screen tv with dvd player and a mini fridge. All in all a most comfortable room. There had been some comments about traffic noise in previous reviews, this probably referred to rooms at the front which overlooked the busy Boulevard de Magenta but our room overlooked a courtyard at the side and was quiet and relaxed. A continental breakfast was provided which included a wide choice of breads, fruit, cereals, cold meats, sausages and scrambled egg. We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay the only thing it lacked was a bar to unwind in or have a nightcap although there were plenty of cafe bars nearby they tended to be a bit frantic and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, modern, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: garyandnic
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute 3 day trip through last minute .com This hotel was top of the list and it didnt look too bad so i clicked ok. (Thats how much i researched it beforehand.!) The hotel is literally two minutes walk from Gare d'lest (down the hill opposite the station turn left onto magenta boulevard and walk about 250metres.) and about 100m from jaques bonsargeant metro station. (come up out of jaques bonsargeant turn right and look for the flags.) The hotel is painted more aubergine than magenta and has flags of the world above the doors. It is easily the most modern facade on the street and looks clean and modern. (easily spotted too.) We couldnt check in till 3pm but there is a baggage room that they are happy to let you store your bags in until your room is ready. (we then went investigating.) The staff are very friendly and helpful and their english is much better than my french. The reception is bright and modern and there are plent y of big comfy chairs to sit in. We noticed a continual cleaning and maintenence schedule during our stay. The lift is very slow, modern but slow. The staircase is a 19th century wonder, very ornate and we got a really cool photo from bottom to top. All the walls are MAGENTA. The room itself was very good indeed. ( i had clicked premium double for an extra 30 quid.) Very clean, modern and the bedding was all clean fresh white linen. The bathroom was clean, smelled fresh and the shower was really hot and powerful. There is a hairdryer built in for those who need it. Flat screen TV and dvd player, with international cable. couple of music channels and bbc world service. mini bar with soft drinks and water. (No alcohol?) Our room (209) was facing the courtyard and was quiet and sunny.(In January!) The buffet breakfast was great, down in the basement they have converted a room into a breakfast room, again, clean modern fixtures and fittings, flat screen tvs etc. breakfast is either scrambled eggs and little saveloy type sausages or fresh fruit, yoghurt, yummy pastries, cold meats and cheeses and great fresh coffee and cream. All in all the hotel was better than we expected and great value for money through last minute dot com. I would definitely book there again and would recommend this hotel to anyone. N.B Paris is very expensive at the moment. (weak pound?) So this hotel seemed like really good value for money, the breakfast sets you up for a day of sightseeing. It is in an ok area and ideal as a hub for investigating paris. as well as the two stations mentioned, about 3 or 4 blocks from the hotel is republique metro station (links to all other metro lines and SNCF lines.) One more thing. book a segway tour. expensive but just do it. The most fun I have had in years. google 'segway paris tours' works out about £65 each but is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: sarahxcore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in Paris, and thought it was great quality and great value for money. Room was spacious, clean and well equipped, staff were helpful, lending us bottle openers and storing bags, breakfast was yummy with a wide selection, and the location was superb, close to metro and Gare du Nord. Only bad point was that one night receptionist couldn't find us another pillow, but the good far outweighs the bad! We would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: gasoline_gut
Reviews.Content: Extremely quite room, could barely hear a sound from the very busy blvd de Magenta right outside - though the walls between the rooms aren't particularly thick. Very comfortable and clean, great location, friendly staff, internet, safe in the room, good breakfast - the works!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scatterlondon
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel- good value, convenient location, clean and well-serviced. It is about 15mins walk from Gare du Nord, making it perfect for a Eurostar break. I had an Econmy Single room, which was small, but not tiny, with a good sized bathroom. The room and the communal areas are spotless. Staff were very helpful, offering to store bags, arrange taxis etc. Breakfast can be served in your room at no extra cost- it was very good. I will deffinitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: josee19963
Reviews.Content: Excellent on every level. The staff, the room, the very confortable bed (a major Plus in France!) the breakfast, the free internet downstairs, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl830
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris over the Thanksgiving holiday and I echo the other positive reviews. It's a great little boutique hotel in a good location close to both the train you ride on around Paris and also the big train station if you're coming in from another country. We came in from Amsterdam and walked to the hotel. The beds were comfy and the breakfast was really delicious. The staff was nice and they speak English. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed”
Reviews.Author: OpinionatedBloke
Reviews.Content: stayed for a couple of nights with a lady friend. though the rooms were a little small the decor was spot on and for the price we paid we were very pleasantly surprised. flashy tv/dvd player, clean room and bathroom (shower only). had an excellent two days, as mentioned by others the staff were very helpful and friendly. highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Savvy81
Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel. Initially stayed in a twin room which was on the smaller side, but when a third person joined us and we moved to a triple room, we had more than enough space. Rooms felt a little stuffy and while there was an air - conditioner, I doubt that it actually worked. Reception staff cannot be faulted. Friendly, fluent in English and more than willing to assist with directions and recommendations. Lift was out of order on our final day but staff moved quickly to have it repaired. Free internet access available was a bonus and location is fantastic. 3 train stations close by, 2 of which are big and handy for those travelling Europe by train. Would definetely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theperks
Reviews.Content: When we were booking this hotel it felt like a little bit of a punt due to some mixed reviews on the location, although we would say the Magenta is in an ideal location to both explore Paris and get a real feel for life in the city. We travelled in on the Eurostar and had no problems finding our way to the hotel from the Gare’d Nord, it’s only a ten minute walk. The hotel itself is not easy to miss: flags outside the entrance and a strange purple/pink facade. Reception staff were welcoming and efficient, we took advice from previous reviews and had asked for a courtyard facing room when we booked, I’d definitely recommend you do this as Boulevard Magenta is a very busy road and although I don’t know for a fact it would disturb your sleep I’d bet that it would. The bed was large and comfortable, bathroom was clean and the only negative would be that the room was very warm; we stayed in November and slept with the window open! Breakfast was fine although basic and could’ve done with a toaster but no complaints there. We walked to several places although the Metro is very easy, depending on where you’re heading you’ll be better off walking to Gare’d L’est or Republique Metro stations which are both 5 minute walks as opposed to the one closest (turn right out of the hotel for Gare’d L’est and left for Republique). From Republique you are only 5 stops I think from “Place de le Concorde”. There are some very nice café bars and places to eat around the Canal and at Place de la Republique, we had a couple of drinks in “Café Pierre” and if you fancy a good pizza you can get one opposite the bar at “MAYA”. Further a field we’d also recommend “La Coupale” which is a fantastic, very large and busy French restaurant (very similar to Bofinger but a little cheaper) and can be found next to “Vavin” metro station where again you’ll find some nice café bars. Also we loved “Roi de Pot au Feu” which is down a side street (Rue Vignon I think?) nearby to “Hauve Camartin” metro station, this place is very busy and small, we arrived at five past eight and stole the last table, were the only non-French there and had a great time dining on their very basic menu of Hot pot and simple French deserts. If you go to this bistro go hungry as the portions are massive and will fill you up until lunch the next day, also don’t be put off by the queues, they queue because it’s good! For our next trip to Paris we will definitely stay at Hotel Magenta, it’s clean, comfortable and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not a tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: bjh1
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here during an autumn break. The hotel is conveniently situated on the the Boulevard de Magenta about a hundred metres from a Metro station and about ten minutes walk from the Gare de L'Est. We stayed in a superior room, but I don't think that the other rooms were of a significantly lower standard. We enjoyed being 'out of the centre' and feeling part of Parisian life but convenient to the main tourist places, pretty well anywhere being no more than two metro rides away. In addition there were lots of local facilities for shopping, eating, laundry etc. The exterior is fairly unattractive - almost a shop front and no glitz. There is, however, a very good reception staff, who are happy to let you practice your pidgin French, whilst at the same time having great foreign language skills themselves, and a great attitude of 'nothing is too much trouble'. The room was well appointed - a large bed, desk and a TV and DVD player. The bathroom was immaculate and well looked after. There was not a lot of space - it was not a room to spend a lot of time in, but then you're in Paris! The room was very quiet, opening on to a courtyard. I cannot say what a room facing the main street would be like, but it is a main thoroughfare so requesting a room at the rear may be worth it. Each morning from six (seven at weekends) a good breakfast buffet is served - all the usual breads, cereals, fruits and yoghurts - but also cold meats, cheeses, hot sausages and scrambled eggs. This alone saved us having to find somewhere for breakfast or pay what can be a hefty supplement - so it's worth taking that in to account when 'doing your sums'. All in all it enhanced our stay in Paris and I commend the hotel to you unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean and comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ethanandselma
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Magenta an ideal base for our short holiday in Paris. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms, and found them modern and very clean. We also hadn't realised that there was good free wi-fi available. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was good. It was a 10 or so minute walk from the main train station, and a great base for sightseeing around Paris. We bought train passes that allowed us to travel easily from the two nearby metro stops. We stayed in the local area at night, and there were plenty of restaurants to choose from within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and Easy Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelleAustralia
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and they all looked great - so I made a booking for a 7 night stay at the Hotel Magenta. It was indeed great, in fact it was wonderful, starting with an easy 15 min walk from the Gare du Nord. Check-in was friendly and my room was clean/fresh and "french" being on the top floor (a few stairs after the lift stop at lvl 6), looking across the rooftops and down into the courtyard below. I loved the room, everything was simple and elegant - as was the bathroom with its great shower and hairdryer. Breakfast had a very delicious choice of hot/cold options and I did try the "breakfast in bed" one morning - Hmmm very nice. The hotel was well located on a main boulevard, and simple to cross and walk down Rue St Martin, St Denis or Rue Sebastopol (which wasn't as interesting on walk back in the evenings), to reach the main heart of Paris and the Seine. It was also a simple walk to the Sacre Coeur - I walked everywhere - except for my time sitting on the Hop On/Off bus, which I also enjoyed to enable an overview of the such a beautiful city. Annabelle, Australia

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Magenta Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 38 blvd de Magenta, 75010 Paris, France
